I had updated components (using the Trac connector) to pick up a new component. When I submitted the task, it failed. After this I couldn't create new tasks (the editor showed an error pane).
Ron, are you editing bugs from the Track repository?
Yes I created a new bug for the Trac repository and was editing it when I hit this problem.
Steffen, it seems like task data is null when repository selection object is created. Seems specific to Trac.

The framework should not allow to instantiate a task editor input without valid task data. TaskDataManager.getEditableCopy() has a few code pathes that return null though. Rob, what is the most likely case to case this error?

(In reply to comment #4)
> The framework should not allow to instantiate a task editor input without valid
> task data. TaskDataManager.getEditableCopy() has a few code pathes that return
> null though. Rob, what is the most likely case to case this error?

TasksUiUtil.refreshAndOpenTaskListElement() checks if taskData == null, if so a job is launched to get it and then blindly tries to open the task. We should test if it was successfully retrieved then proceed.
I just checked in the fix for issue mentioned in comment#5.
*** Bug 206578 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 206738 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I have marked the reports as duplicates that describe the same problem which has a common cause: 

After refreshing attributes refreshInput() is invoked on the editor input. The method tries to fetch taskData from TaskDataManager which returns null since the task does not exist, yet. This leaves the editor input object in a broken state causing various errors.
